extends java.lang.Object

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double lat,
                        double lon)
        Sets the location to a single coordinate. This creates a "closest to" selection search.
        Parameters:
        lat - Latitude
        lon - Longitude

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double lat,
                        double lon,
                        double radius)
        Sets the location to within a radius around a single coordinate. This creates a "within radius" selection search.
        Parameters:
        lat - Latitude
        lon - Longitude
        radius - Radius (in meters)

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(double minLat,
                        double minLon,
                        double maxLat,
                        double maxLon)
        Sets the location to within a rectangle. This creates a "bounding box" selection search.
        Parameters:
        minLat - Minimum latitude
        minLon - Minimum longitude
        maxLat - Maximum latitude
        maxLon - Maximum longitude

      • setDate

        public void setDate(java.util.Date from,
                    java.util.Date to)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the date range for data search. If the "to" date exceeds the current date, a forecast URI will be possible to generate (see below). If both "from" and "to" dates excee the current date, a data URI will not be possible to generate.
        Parameters:
        from - A date object to search from
        to - A date object to search to - must be after the "from" date
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Raised if "to" date is at or before the "from" date

      • setDate

        public void setDate(java.util.Date at,
                    int buffer)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the date around a central time.
        Parameters:
        at - A date object to search around
        buffer - A buffer to pad the date with (in milliseconds)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception that should never be raised when using this particular method

      • setDate

        public void setDate(java.util.Date at)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets the date around a central time. Uses a default buffer of +/- 2 hours.
        Parameters:
        at - A date object to search around
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An exception that should never be raised when using this particular method

      • removeDate

        public void removeDate()
        Removes the date range filter. This will result in the REST API returning the latest readings.

      • addObservable

        public void addObservable(java.lang.String observable)
        Adds an observable to be requested from the API.
        Parameters:
        observable - An observable as a string - refer to the Pylaski documentation (link above)

      • removeObservable

        public void removeObservable(java.lang.String observable)
        Removes a previously added observable.
        Parameters:
        observable - An observable as a string

      • setObservables

        public void setObservables(java.lang.String[] observables)
        Sets the list of observables.
        Parameters:
        observables - A list of observables - refer to the Pylaski documentation (link above)

      • getDataURI

        public java.net.URI getDataURI()
                        throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Generates the REST URI for retrieving past and present observable data.
        Returns:
        A request URI
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If the URI is invalid

      • getForecastURI

        public java.net.URI getForecastURI(boolean hrrrx)
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Generates the REST URI for retrieving future/forecast observable data.
        Parameters:
        hrrrx - Whether to use the HRRRx forecast data
        Returns:
        A request URI
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If the URI is invalid

      • getForecastURI

        public java.net.URI getForecastURI()
                            throws java.net.URISyntaxException
        Generates the REST URI for retrieving future/forecast observable data. Defaults the HRRRx setting to false.
        Returns:
        A request URI
        Throws:
        java.net.URISyntaxException - If the URI is invalid
